page.title: 16HOMELIFE-HALWELL&MORELEIGH
page.content: Life at home in rural areas differs only in detail from urban life, but the details loom large. Open fires and solid fuel cooking stoves create heavy work to add to the constant battle against mud in the Winter and dust in the Summer. The lack of Town gas and mains sewage in the outlying areas creates its own problems. Having nothing but the most basic amenities makes for both self sufficiency and arduous trips to distant Towns. The closing of the village school sends the children from the village all day and transfers their social centre, so that parents spend much time chauffering on a rota basis. Lack of public transport creates entertaiment and employment problems,but despite all the difficulties a strong sense of family and community exists.
